name: untalented
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not having the natural ability to be good at anything, or at a particular activity: This is the sort of work an untalented apprentice might churn out. Opposite
talented
More examplesFewer examplesThe recipes look achievable for even the most untalented amateur cook.For such an apparently untalented, unacademic and solitary boy, his career choice was limited.She was considered relatively untalented by the diving coaches.The show made incredibly ordinary, untalented and not very good-looking people suddenly very famous.
